subject: build.xml test target
msgSnippet: Could we please have a separate test target in the build.xml file so that ant test works as one would expect? Something like this should do the trick:
messageBody:
Could we please have a separate test target in the build.xml file so
that "ant test" works as one would expect? Something like this should do
the trick:

<target name="test" depends="build">
<java classname="org.junit.runner.JUnitCore" fork="yes">
<!--There must be a more intelligent way to do this-->
<arg value="org.junit.tests.AnnotationTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.AssertionTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.CommandLineTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.ForwardCompatibilityTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.OldTests"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.PreJUnit4TestCaseRunnerTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.TestMethodTest"/>
<arg value="org.junit.tests.TextListenerTest"/>
<classpath>
<pathelement location="${dist}" />
<pathelement location="${dist}/junit.jar" />
</classpath>
</java>

</target>

Then the dist target could depend on the test rather than the build:

<target name="dist" depends="test">
<delete dir="${dist}" />
<mkdir dir="${dist}" />
<jar
jarfile="${dist}/src.jar"
basedir="."
excludes="**/*.jar, junit/tests/**, junit/samples/**, **/*.class,
doc/**, README.html, .classpath, .project, cpl-v10.html"
/>
<jar
jarfile="${dist}/junit.jar"
basedir="."
excludes="**/*.jar, junit/tests/**, junit/samples/**, **/*.java,
doc/**, README.html, build.xml, jar-manifest.txt, .classpath, .project,
cpl-v10.html"
/>
<copy todir="${dist}/junit/samples">
<fileset dir="junit/samples" />
</copy>
<copy todir="${dist}/junit/tests">
<fileset dir="junit/tests" />
</copy>

<mkdir dir="${dist}/javadoc" />
<javadoc
sourcepath="."
packagenames="org.junit, org.junit.runner"
destdir="${dist}/javadoc"
author="false"
version="false"
use="false"
windowtitle="JUnit API"
stylesheetfile="stylesheet.css"
/>
<copy todir="${dist}/doc">
<fileset dir="doc"/>
</copy>
<copy file="README.html" tofile="${dist}/README.html" />
<copy file="cpl-v10.html" tofile="${dist}/cpl-v10.html" />

</target>

Thanks.
